title: Finding the Y-Intercept
text: We must set $$x$$ equal to $$0$$ and then solve for f(x). When we do this, we get $$f(x)=\frac{5}{4}$$. Thus, our y-intercept is $$(0,\frac{5}{4})$$

title: Finding the X-Intercept
text: Now, we must set f(x) equal to $$0$$ and solve for $$x$$. $$\frac{x+5}{x^2+4}=0$$. This is $$0$$ when the numerator is equal to $$0$$. $$x+5=0$$. This means that the x-intercept is $$(-5,0)$$.
